intro: Geranium sanguineum subsp. sanguineiforme, commonly known as the blood geranium, is a perennial herb native to southern Europe. It features upright, branched stems that bear opposite, heart-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. The plant produces clusters of small, pink to red flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for rock gardens. Its ornamental value comes from its vibrant blooms and attractive foliage.
